Module jGame
Package jGame.core.entity

Class EntityManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • jGame.core.entity.EntityManager
  • public class EntityManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class serves as a register for all Entities present in the game, renderable or not. In addition, a list for all entities queued for removal is maintained.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Nuno Pereira

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private static java.util.ArrayList<Entity> ENTITIES_LIST  
      private static java.util.ArrayList<Entity> ENTITIES_TO_REMOVE_LIST  

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      EntityManager()  

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static void addEntity​(Entity entityToAdd)
      Adds an entity to the entities list, if it isn't already present, otherwise return.
      static java.util.ArrayList<Entity> getEntitiesList()
      Returns a copy of the entities list.
      static void registerInputListeners()
      Registers the key input listeners for every Entity present in the entities list.
      static void removeEntity​(int entityIndex)
      Queues the entity at index entityIndex of the entities List for removal (adds it to the entity removal list).
      static void removeEntity​(Entity entityToRemove)
      Queues the given entity for removal (adds it to the entity removal list).
      static void renderEntities​(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
      Renders all entities that are marked as renderable.
      static void tickEntities()
      Updates all the entities before rendering them on the screen.
      static void updateEntities​(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
      Deprecated.
      since the main loop runs so fast, ticks happen very less often than renders, so we need to separate those to commands

        entityToAdd - the entity to add to the game

      • removeEntity

        public static void removeEntity​(int entityIndex)
        Queues the entity at index entityIndex of the entities List for removal (adds it to the entity removal list).
        Parameters:
        entityIndex - the index of the entity to remove
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • removeEntity

        public static void removeEntity​(Entity entityToRemove)
        Queues the given entity for removal (adds it to the entity removal list).
        Parameters:
        entityToRemove - the entity to remove
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • updateEntities

        @Deprecated
public static void updateEntities​(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Deprecated.
        since the main loop runs so fast, ticks happen very less often than renders, so we need to separate those to commands
        Updates all entities on screen. This method behaves exactly as: 
          foreach entity:
        entity.tick()
        entity.render(g)
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics object responsible for rendering the objects on the screen.
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        updateEntities(java.awt.Graphics2D), tickEntities()

      • renderEntities

        public static void renderEntities​(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Renders all entities that are marked as renderable.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics object responsible for rendering the objects on the screen.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • tickEntities

        public static void tickEntities()
        Updates all the entities before rendering them on the screen. The entity removal list is traversed beforehand in order to remove from the "update queue" any entity we do not wish to update anymore.
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        Entity.tick()

      • getEntitiesList

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Entity> getEntitiesList()
        Returns a copy of the entities list.
        Returns:
        a copy of the entities list.
        Since:
        1.0.0
